library

Class Fiction

  • java.lang.Object
    • library.Book
      • library.Fiction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DatabaseEntry

    public class Fiction
extends Book
    This class represents a fiction book that can be added to the Fiction table in the database. It inherits from Book

        public Fiction()
        Default constructor. Creates a new Fiction object

      • Fiction

        public Fiction(int i)
        Parameterized constructor. Creates a new Fiction object with the given ID number
        Parameters:

      • Fiction

        public Fiction(Book b)
        Create a Fiction Object from the given Book. This method was created because one can not simply cast a Book to a Fiction object.
        Parameters:
        b - Book to convert to a Fiction

      • Fiction

        public Fiction(java.lang.String t,
               int m,
               int y,
               double p,
               Shop plc,
               int pub,
               java.util.ArrayList<Author> a,
               Genre g,
               BookType ty,
               Series s,
               int n)
        Parameterized constructor. Creates a new Fiction object with the given attributes.
        Parameters:
        t - title of Fiction
        m - month Fiction was bought
        y - year Fiction was bought
        p - priced paid for Fiction was bought
        plc - Shop where Fiction was bought
        pub - year Fiction was first published
        a - ArrayList of Authors of this Fiction
        g - genre of this Fiction
        n - number in Series
        s - Series that this book is part of
        ty - BookType of book

      • Fiction

        public Fiction(Fiction copy)
        Copy constructor. Creates a new Fiction object equal to the one given as parameter
        Parameters:
